prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a circular hole through it. Sketch Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0523, 0.0]. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines. Start with a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. The second line starts at [0.75, 0.0] and ends at [0.75, 0.314]. The third line begins at [0.75, 0.314] and ends at [0.0, 0.314]. Lastly, draw a line from [0.0, 0.314] back to [0.0, 0.0] to close the rectangle. Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0.0523 units in the direction of the positive Z-axis and 0 units in the negative Z-axis. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation with the preceding CAD models. Part 2: Create a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center. Sketch Create a new coordinate system with Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector set to [0.061, 0.0, 0.0698]. Create two circles on two separate planes in the sketch. The first circle is centered at point [0.0698, 0.0698] and has a radius of 0.0698 units. The second circle is centered at point [0.5581, 0.0698] with the same radius. Extrusion Perform an extrusion with 0 depth in the positive Z-axis direction and 0.0698 depth in the negative Z-axis direction. Scale the sketch by approximately 0.6279. Perform a CutFeatureOperation with the preceding CAD models. The height, width, and length of each of the intermediate parts and the final shape adhere to the specified JSON values. You only need to provide the instructions as described, without making any assumptions.</description>

prompt: <description>**CAD Model Instructions** **Part 1** Construct a large, flat, circular object with a slightly curved edge. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Create a new sketch on face 1. Draw a circle with center [0.2208, 0.2208] and radius 0.2208. The circle represents loop 1 and face 1. Use a sketch scale of 0.4415. Do not extrude yet. **Part 2** Construct a three-dimensional, geometric shape with a flat base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0008, 0.0, 0.2208]. Create a new sketch on face 1. Draw line 1 from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.2199, 0.0], line 2 from point [0.2199, 0.0] to point [0.2199, 0.75], line 3 from point [0.2199, 0.75] to point [0.1716, 0.75], and line 4 from point [0.1716, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.0]. This forms loop 1. On the same face, draw a second loop (loop 2) by connecting [0.2199, 0.0] to [0.4403, 0.0], [0.4403, 0.0] to [0.2683, 0.75], [0.2683, 0.75] to [0.2199, 0.75], and [0.2199, 0.75] to [0.2199, 0.0]. Use a sketch scale of 0.75. The two loops form face 1 and face 2. Extrude both faces by 0.006 units in the direction of the normal, and join the extrusion with the preceding CAD model. The final CAD model should resemble a cylindrical object with a pointed tip, similar to a stylized cone.</description>
